channel.title: DVD Audio? - In car
channel.description: Well my new vehicle supports DVD-Audio and I want to know how to take advantage of that? Is there any converting software that will automatically take the 2 channel music and split it into separate channels?

item.title: DVD Audio? - In car
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Just to update I actually get to drive my car now that I have insurance on it. This 2005 acura rl is a FUCKING ROCKEt. this is the fastest car I have ever drive and with the sh-awd I can take turns so fucking fast its ridiculous. Ill post car pics Saturday once it gets around 50 degrees, right now its 10 so I really don’t want to stay outside long plus the fact that there is still some snow and ice.

Read full topic

item.title: DVD Audio? - In car
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Well the difference is if the audio is two channel the bose system does its own realtime upscaling and it sends it out to the speakers. I am curious to what is better, letting the car figure out what to send to the speakers or having it done already.

Once thing also that I think contributed is that the dvd holds audio information that the cd cant hold so I think that might have made it sound a tad better (probably cant tell the difference). I am going to try an mp3 cd tomorrow.

Read full topic

item.title: DVD Audio? - In car
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Again, the separate audio channels accomplished nothing because you are still just listening to 2 channels. (even though you split them into more, it’s still just 2 channels). So that means it’s just the speaker system.

Read full topic

item.title: DVD Audio? - In car
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Well I got my car today. Took me 3 hours to make an dvd audio disc because of the insanely high priced software involved to make the disc. I had to find something I could get free and was simple to use. I upscaped the audio from 2 channel to 5.1 Using AVS Audio Converter 6 and then I used DVD-Audio Solo to make the disc. It sounds incredible like nothing I ever heard before. I don’t know if its the 10 speaker bose system or the disc with separate audio channels but it was great. I havent tried a cd yet so I have nothing to compare to except my old car.

Read full topic

item.title: DVD Audio? - In car
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You can probably do that anyway, without being in a special format.

Read full topic

item.title: DVD Audio? - In car
item.dc:creator: @mwiebelhaus mwiebelhaus
item.description:
@mwiebelhaus wrote:

Yeah its surround sound but its burned to a special format on a dvd called dvd-a or something. I think the only advantage of this for me is that I can put insanely large amounts of songs on a dvd 8.4gb worth and then put it in my car.

Read full topic

item.title: DVD Audio? - In car
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

I wasn’t aware there was a special thing called ‘DVD-Audio’, do you by chance mean surround sound? Like 5.1 or something similar? I’ll tell you right now you won’t gain anything from splitting 2 channels into more channels than that, no matter what, it will just take up more space and produce identical results.

Read full topic
